title: Aircraft Performance Engineer 1
description:
Overview

We are seeking a full-time Aircraft Performance Engineer 1 in our Olathe, KS, Chandler, AZ or Scottsdale, AZ location. In this role, you will be responsible for learning and applying knowledge of aircraft performance systems, operator policies, and regulatory requirements to develop and enhance aircraft performance calculation software to meet customer needs. Examples include computing takeoff and landing performance (vspeeds, distances required, climb gradients, etc.) based on available runway parameters, meteorological conditions, obstacle and terrain geometry and aircraft-specific performance data. Calculating time and fuel estimates utilizing lateral and vertical guidance for flight plans, and other aircraft performance related features.

Essential Functions
• Design, develop, test, and deploy aircraft performance systems
• Learn and utilize programming techniques to assist with solving small-to-mid-scale problems
• Work independently and with internal development teams to develop and test full system functionality
• Calculate, analyze, and document basic aircraft performance data
• Communicate aircraft performance related information to internal staff and customers
• Ability to plan, coordinate and schedule effectively
• Able to identify and resolve defects using proper engineering tools and techniques such as debuggers and simulators
• Work collaboratively and professionally in a team environment with other Garmin associates and aircraft manufacturers

Basic Qualifications
• Bachelor’s Degree in Aeronautical Engineering, Physics, Mathematics or related field OR an equivalent combination of education and experience
• Excellent academics (cumulative GPA greater than or equal to 3.0 as a general rule)
• Programming and scripting experience (FORTRAN, Python or a similar programming language)
• Strong and effective verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills
• Driven problem solver with exceptional technical troubleshooting, organizational and time management skills and demonstrated ability to resolve problems with minimal supervision

Desired Qualifications
• Experience with Aircraft Performance Data
• Experience in creating software that complies with aircraft performance regulations
• Experience in developing software for a Flight Management System (FMS)
• Experience with DO-178B/DO-178C certification
• FAA Private Pilot License
• Experience in working with Aviation Authorities (FAA/EASA)
• Experience with Airworthiness Standards (Part 23 and Part 25)
